entities: International Tribunal for the former Yugoslavia
summary:
The Security Council, 
Taking note of the Secretary-General's letter and the International Tribunal for the former Yugoslavia's ("the International Tribunal") President's letter, 
Recalling its previous resolutions, particularly 827 (1993), 1503 (2003), and 1534 (2004), 
Noting the International Tribunal's Completion Strategy Report, 
Expressing concern that the International Tribunal will not complete its work in 2010, 
Concerned about the loss of experienced staff, 
Recalling its intention to extend judges' terms of office, 
Acting under Chapter VII of the Charter, 
1. Reaffirms the necessity of trial of persons indicted by the International Tribunal and calls for cooperation and assistance, particularly the arrest of Ratko Mladić and Goran Hadžić; 
2. Notes the importance of adequate staffing for the International Tribunal to complete its work and calls for cooperation to address staffing issues; 
3. Extends the terms of office of the following permanent judges in the Appeals Chamber until 31 December 2012 or until completion of their cases: 
- Carmel Agius (Malta) 
- Liu Daqun (China) 
- Theodor Meron (United States of America) 
- Fausto Pocar (Italy) 
- Patrick Robinson (Jamaica) 
4. Extends the terms of office of the following permanent judges in the Trial Chamber until 31 December 2011 or until completion of their cases: 
- Jean-Claude Antonetti (France) 
- Guy Delvoie (Belgium) 
- Burton Hall (The Bahamas) 
- Christoph Flügge (Germany) 
- O-Gon Kwon (South Korea) 
- Bakone Justice Moloto (South Africa) 
- Howard Morrison (United Kingdom) 
- Alphons Orie (The Netherlands)
The Security Council:

5. Extends the term of office of the following ad litem judges at the International Tribunal, members of the Trial Chamber, until 31 December 2011 or until completion of assigned cases, if sooner: 
- Melville Baird (Trinidad and Tobago)
- Pedro David (Argentina)
- Elizabeth Gwaunza (Zimbabwe)
- Frederik Harhoff (Denmark)
- Flavia Lattanzi (Italy)
- Antoine Kesia-Mbe Mindua (Democratic Republic of Congo)
- Prisca Matimba Nyambe (Zambia)
- Michèle Picard (France)
- Árpád Prandler (Hungary)
- Stefan Trechsel (Switzerland)

6. Intends to extend trial judges' terms by 30 June 2011 based on the Tribunal's projected trial schedule, and requests the President to submit an updated schedule by 15 May 2011.
